fullDescription.text: An object A expects an object B to have been used correctly (CrySL blocks REQUIRES and ENSURES). For example a Cipher object requires a SecretKey object to be correctly and securely generated.
The ORDER block of CrySL is violated, i.e., the expected method sequence call to be made is incorrect. For example, a Signature object expects a call to initSign(key) prior to update(data).

message.text: Unexpected call to method <javax.crypto.Mac: byte[] doFinal(byte[])> on object of type javax.crypto.Mac. Expect a call to one of the following methods javax.crypto.Mac: void doFinal(byte[],int),javax.crypto.Mac: void update(byte[]),javax.crypto.Mac: byte[] doFinal(),javax.crypto.Mac: void update(byte),javax.crypto.Mac: void update(byte[],int,int).
message.richText: TypestateError violating CrySL rule for javax.crypto.Mac.

message.text: First parameter was not properly generated as prepared Key Material.
message.richText: RequiredPredicateError violating CrySL rule for javax.crypto.spec.SecretKeySpec.
